intro: Telis subracemosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf telis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Telis subracemosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors.
